item.title: Logging in Python
item.description: Python does not come with reasonable logging defaults. The following code usually prints nothing. import logging logging.info("Hello world") While it does provide `logging.basicConfig()` which kinda works (sets up stderr by default), I prefer setting this up myself. This snippet sets up logging, adds a formatter and outputs error/info logs to the respective std streams. Without setting up the filter for errors, log aggregators confuse a python error log with an info log.
